description: From Ancient Greek δυσπραξίᾱ (duspraxíā, “ill success, ill luck”), after the pattern of apraxia.

entries.meaning: (medicine) A genetic neurological disorder where a person has motor skills severely below average due to their brain's inability to consistently send messages accurately to the body for the planning of motor movements.
examples: He had to quit dishwashing at the restaurant because his dyspraxia made him unable to do the work.
